intro: Urobotrya longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Urobotrya longipes is typically found in quartzitic soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
